intro: Conioselinum wolffianum, commonly known as the Wolffian wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a faintly aromatic scent. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
